sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Arihant Verma)
articles.description: In this article, we’ll discuss and learn about the use case of iterating over React `children` and the ways to do it. In particular, we will deep dive into one of the utility methods, `React.Children.toArray`, that React gives us, which helps to iterate over the children in a way which ensures performance and determinism.
articles.title: React Children And Iteration Methods

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Callum Hart)
articles.description: Resilience is intrinsic to the web and therefore us, web developers. This article explores how graceful degradation, defensive coding, observability, and a healthy attitude towards failures better equips us before, during, and after an error occurs.
articles.title: How To Build Resilient JavaScript UIs

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: In this article, we’ll take a deep dive into the refactoring process itself, and cover incremental refactoring strategy, visual regression testing, and maintaining the refactored codebase.
articles.title: Refactoring CSS: Strategy, Regression Testing And Maintenance (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: New month, new wallpapers! In this post, you’ll find unique and inspiring wallpapers for August 2021. Created with love by the community for the community, they come in versions with and without a calendar for the month.
articles.title: Good Vibes In August (2021 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: Having an e-commerce store is crucial for any store owner as more and more customers are turning to online shopping. In this tutorial, we shall go through how to create an e-commerce site with Angular 11. The site will use the Commerce Layer as a headless e-commerce API and use Paypal to process payments.
articles.title: How To Build An E-Commerce Site With Angular 11, Commerce Layer And Paypal

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Elad Shechter)
articles.description: What are absolute units? What are the differences between relative and absolute units, and how do we create accurate sizes on the web? In this article, Elad Shechter explains why CSS absolute units aren’t so absolute.
articles.title: There Is No Such Thing As A CSS Absolute Unit

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kitty Giraudel)
articles.description: Dialogs are everywhere in modern interface design (for good or for bad), and yet many of them are not accessible to assistive technologies. In this article, we will dig into how to create a short script to create accessible dialogs.
articles.title: Creating An Accessible Dialog From Scratch

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexander Dubovoy)
articles.description: Next.js has strong opinions about how to organize JavaScript but not CSS. How can we develop patterns that encourage best CSS practices while also following the framework’s logic? The answer is surprisingly simple — to write well-structured CSS that balances global and local styling concerns.
articles.title: Global vs. Local Styling In Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Scanlon)
articles.description: Gatsby recently announced the launch of “functions”. In this article, Paul Scanlon explains how to get the current location of the International Space Station (ISS) as it orbits the Earth in real-time using [Gatsby Functions](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/reference/functions/) and then display it on a 3D interactive globe using [React Three Fibre](https://github.com/pmndrs/react-three-fiber).
articles.title: Gatsby Serverless Functions And The International Space Station

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: Many web design agencies consider it a badge of honor that they win work exclusively through word-of-mouth recommendations. In this article, Paul Boag explains why that is entirely the wrong attitude and what to do about it.
articles.title: A Guide To Attracting Clients To Your Agency

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Matthew Talebi)
articles.description: Are you running a business and have too many things going on at once? Meetings, bugs, customer feedback, new clients in addition to your already tight deadlines? Let’s face it, time management is hard, and it becomes even more difficult in the trying times we are in.
articles.title: Adding Time To Your Schedule As A Professional

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Do you need a little inspiration boost? We’ve collected some useful color tools and resources that we’ve discovered lately — to help you get the most out of your creativity. We’ve also just recently covered [CSS auditing tools](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/03/css-auditing-tools/), [CSS generators](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/03/css-generators/), [accessible front-end components](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/03/complete-guide-accessible-front-end-components/), [front-end boilerplates](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/06/useful-frontend-boilerplates-starter-kits/) and [VS code extensions](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/useful-vs-code-extensions-web-developers/) — you might find them useful, too.
articles.title: Color Tools And Resources

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alba Silvente)
articles.description: In this article, we will look at when it makes sense to migrate from a monolithic project to a headless setup and the benefits that come with it. In addition to a step-by-step guide on how to migrate WordPress to Storyblok Headless CMS, the problems that will arise during the process and how to deal with them.
articles.title: How To Migrate From WordPress To A Headless CMS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Colby Fayock)
articles.description: By adding visual elements to your tests, you can gain more options to add meaningful ways in maintaining a high level of quality for your app. Colby Fayock explains how.
articles.title: Maintaining End-To-End Quality With Visual Testing

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Marcus Herrmann)
articles.description: Web app accessibility appears difficult because it seems that there is little information on the subject available online. Let’s take a closer look at the accessible use of framework features, concrete Vue.js traits, as well as community initiatives and vetted patterns.
articles.title: Three Insights I Gained While Researching Vue.js Accessibility

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cassidy Williams)
articles.description: There are two strategies for incrementally building websites that are growing in popularity: Incremental Static Regeneration and Distributed Persistent Rendering. What’s the difference? Let’s figure it out.
articles.title: ISR vs DPR: Big Words, Quick Explanation

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: In this article, you’ll get to see some pretty groundbreaking things you can achieve with modern JavaScript grids and discover new ways to augment a data grid to make it engaging, responsive, and accessible. All this will be illustrated using Kendo UI Data Grids and their features.
articles.title: You Can Do That With A JavaScript Data Grid?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Too often dealing with filters can be frustrating. Let’s get them right. That means never freeze the UI on a single input, provide text input fallback and never auto-scroll users on a single input. Here’s why.
articles.title: Frustrating Design Patterns: Broken Filters

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: In JavaScript, attaching an event listener to constantly fire a callback on scroll can be performance-intensive. But there is a better way with Intersection Observer.
articles.title: Building A Dynamic Header With Intersection Observer

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Facundo Giuliani)
articles.description: In this article, we’re taking a closer look at different approaches and strategies on how we can migrate a web application that uses jQuery framework, and start using one of the coolest React frameworks in the market: Next.js.
articles.title: How To Migrate From jQuery To Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: CSS refactoring is not an easy task — it needs to be done in a way that doesn't create problems. First we need to analyze the existing codebase, audit CSS codebase health, discover weaknesses, agree on the approach, and convince management to invest time and resources into the process.
articles.title: Refactoring CSS: Introduction (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Todd Libby)
articles.description: Accessibility is often overlooked or bolted on to the end of a project. Let’s figure out how to implement and advocate for accessibility from the inception of a project to the release or handoff and beyond.
articles.title: Making A Strong Case For Accessibility

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Uma Victor)
articles.description: Even though Vue.js claims to have an approachable minimalist framework that can be incrementally adaptable, it can be a little bit overwhelming when starting as a Vue.js newbie. In this article, we’re looking at ways to make writing Vue.js a breeze.
articles.title: Tools And Practices To Speed Up The Vue.js Development Process

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Emiliano Cicero)
articles.description: Interactive Components in Figma allows designers to create a component with states (hover, active, clicked, focus) and make it interactive so that every copy of the component will inherit those same interactions by default. Let’s explore how it can reduce the time and effort needed to create interactions for your mock-ups.
articles.title: An Introduction To Figma Interactive Components

articles.description: In CSS, everything is a box. And each box – whether it's text, an image, a div, a span, or any other element – has a border that separates its edges from other boxes around it.  The CSS border property allows us to do several things with the border of individual boxes.
articles.title: CSS Border – Style and HTML Code Examples

articles.description: In this article, we are going to learn about CSS padding properties, the shorthand property, and how padding differs from margin.  What is padding in CSS?CSS padding creates space around the element's content. This space is within the element's border and margin.  Let's take a look at the CSS
articles.title: HTML Padding – CSS Padding Order

articles.description: Sometimes when you're working with SQL, you don't need to operate on an entire range of records. Or it would be really bad if you accidentally changed or deleted everything. In these cases, you'll need to select only the part of the records on which you want to work, those
articles.title: SQL Where – Clause Examples

articles.description: Even with helpful tools like CSS Grid and Flexbox, centering elements in CSS remains notoriously challenging.  It's been the subject of many jokes and memes, and when you successfully center something, you'll want to brag about it.  Why is Centering CSS Elements So Hard? CSS can be tricky to work
articles.title: CSS Vertical Align – How to Center a Div, Text, or an Image [Example Code]

articles.description: You have started creating your HTML page, and you want to give it some color – maybe change the color of the text or set a nice background. So how do you do that? In this article I'll show you how you can change the background color of a page in
articles.title: CSS Background Color – How to Change the Background Color in HTML

articles.description: During technical interviews it is common for people to be asked to solve coding challenges. It is important to have a good understanding of graph algorithms if you  want to make sure to do well on these challenges. We just released a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that
articles.title: Graph Algorithms for Technical Interviews

articles.description: React continues to be a popular front-end JavaScript library. Improve your skills by building a dictionary project. We just released a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to create a dictionary app with React and Material UI. You will learn to create a dictionary
articles.title: Code a Dictionary with React and Material UI

articles.description: There are various types of loops in JavaScript, and all of them essentially do the same thing: they repeat an action again and again.  Loops come in handy if you want to repeat the same block of code for a certain number of times. Basically, they are a fast and
articles.title: JavaScript For Loop – How to Loop Through an Array in JS

articles.description: Alone, we can do so little; together, we can do so much.  Helen Keller  It’s true – when you lend someone a helping hand, you feel a lot better about yourself, and you will likely learn something new.  Helping others feels so rewarding because you know that you have contributed
articles.title: Developer Communities to Join to Help You Grow Your Tech Career

articles.description: The copy and paste functionality on Android smartphones might seem to be a "one-time" thing. Once you copy a snippet of text, you need to paste it before copying or cutting another. If you don't, you won't have access to it anymore.  Also, if you copy text and
articles.title: How to Access Clipboard in Android (and Clear it)
